intro: Celmisia lateralis, commonly known as the silver fern, is a herbaceous plant native to New Zealand. It is characterized by its distinctive silver-white leaves that are covered in fine, silky hairs. The plant produces small, bell-shaped flowers that range in color from yellow to orange, typically blooming in spring. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in forested areas. Due to its unique appearance and ecological significance, it is a valued species in New Zealand's flora.
